result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pedro J Gomez Martinez

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 20CF1263, 22CF299, 20TR7250 are called at 3:33 PM) Defendant Pedro J Gomez Martinez in court, in custody.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Pedro J Gomez Martinez.  Deputy District Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. State states that their notes indicate that the Defendant waived his right to a preliminary in 20CF1263 on 01/26/2021. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. Defendant pleads No Contest in 20CF1263 Count 1- Threat to Law Enforcement Officer and Count 2- OWI 2nd Offense. Defendant acknowledges right to an interpreter and wishes to proceed today without an interpreter. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including 22CF299 and 22FO240. 
Count 1- Court withholds sentence and orders 24 months Probation with the following conditions: 90 days jail all stayed pending further order of the Court; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. 22 days credit, if revoked. 
Count 2- $1,429.00 fine including costs, 10 days jail with Huber with 22 days credit, 12 months driver license revocation, 12 months IID, AODA and follow through with recommendations, Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Discussion held regarding jail credit. 
20TR7250- Court finds refusal not reasonable, $50 fine, 12 months driver license revocation, 12 months IID, AODA and follow through with recommendations.
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Attempted Not Known, Unable to Forward

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:17 AM case called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Pedro J Gomez Martinez appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Sonia Anderson. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of the complaint. State requests $5,000 cash bond with argument. Defense requests a signature bond with argument. Court orders $2,000 cash bond. 
Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 3/28 at 2:30 PM.  
Hearing scheduled for 4-20-22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level if released from custody.
